result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court finds probable cause & orders a competency evaluation. 
Court requests victim/witness key code. ADA Gabler emailed a copy to the Judge.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Competency hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements - UA's

Attorney Ali M Mahmood appeared by video for Taylor Thomas Bast. Received complaint/waived reading. Defendant advised of rights.Competency raised. 950 Marcy's law complied with. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
